6,000 native seedlings to be planted along two highway stretches in Pudukottai district
description: Get ready for some green action in Pudukottai! The Pudukottai Forest Division is on a mission to plant 6,000 native seedlings along the Pudukottai-Thanjavur and Tiruchi-Karaikudi highways, all in the name of battling air pollution and boosting our planet’s green vibes. With funding from the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) and support from the Green Tamil Nadu Mission, this eco-friendly project is set to kick off between October and November 2026. After successfully planting 5,000 seedlings in the previous year, this initiative aims at making our roads a lot leafier and the air a lot fresher!

Trapped at the desk: Why 23% of US workers skip vacation despite paid leave
description: Despite widespread access to paid vacation, nearly a quarter of US workers did not take a single day off last year, FlexJobs reports. Heavy workloads, fear of falling behind, and insufficient PTO leave employees trapped in a cycle of constant work. Experts warn that cultural and structural reforms are essential to make rest a viable, sustainable priority.

title: Canada’s ‘Maple Dream’ wanes: Student intake falls; India feels the pinch
description: Canada’s international education sector faces an unprecedented slowdown, with new student arrivals dropping nearly 60% in 2025 compared to last year. Tighter permit caps, stricter financial and work regulations, and revised post-study pathways have deliberately shrunk the pipeline. The decline hits classrooms, campuses, and local economies, with Indian students—Canada’s largest overseas cohort—bearing the brunt of these structural changes.

title: Watch: Ladakh statehood talks resume: What is MHA offering?
description: Talks between Ladakh’s civil society groups and the Union Home Ministry resumed in New Delhi after last month’s deadly protests demanding Statehood. Officials hinted at possible safeguards under Article 371, but the Leh Apex Body and Kargil Democratic Alliance reiterated their demand for inclusion under the Sixth Schedule. The groups also sought the release of activist Sonam Wangchuk. With tensions high since Ladakh lost its special status in 2019, the region awaits clarity on its political future and autonomy.

title: Karan Johar's Ozempic joke: What you ought to know about weight loss drug
description: Ozempic, a diabetes drug, is gaining traction for weight loss, fuelled by celebrity buzz like Karan Johar's transformation. Experts emphasize it complements lifestyle changes, not replaces them, and medical supervision is vital for safe and effective use.

Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor'; Anand Vihar hits 'severe' category
description: Delhi's air quality remains hazardous post-Diwali, with 'severe' pollution levels recorded in Anand Vihar.  Many areas are in the 'very poor' category, prompting authorities to activate Stage II of the GRAP.  Residents report breathing difficulties as smog blankets the city, with transport and industries contributing significantly to the pollution.

title: 'More of a boutique hotel': TV, fully-equipped toilet and more; photos show swish jail awaiting Choksi
description: Fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi, wanted for Rs 13,000 crore bank fraud, is set for extradition to India and will be housed in a specially equipped cell at Arthur Road jail.  Indian authorities presented evidence to a Belgian court showcasing the cell's comfort and security, adhering to European standards.

title: Hold your breath! Annual punishment begins as Delhi sees toxic PM2.5 levels
description: Delhi experienced its worst PM2.5 pollution levels of the year following Diwali, with concentrations soaring to dangerous heights. Analysis revealed alarming figures, with some areas exceeding national and WHO guidelines significantly. Even days later, pollution remained exceptionally high, posing serious health risks as fine particles penetrate the bloodstream.

title: Bad air: Punjab official goes to put out farm fire, gheraoed for 2 hours in Mansa
description: Farmers in Mansa, Punjab, surrounded a Punjab Pollution Control Board official. The incident occurred after the official arrived to douse a farm fire. Farmers demanded more balers to manage crop residue. The official was held for nearly two hours before police intervened and secured his release. This marks the first such backlash against government officials this year.

title: UP man kills wife, buries body beneath bed; sleeps over it for 12 days
description: A man in Bahraich, UP, has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and burying her body under their bed, sleeping over it for 12 days. Phoola Devi's family grew suspicious after noticing freshly plastered mud and alerted the police, who discovered her decomposed body with multiple injuries. The motive is suspected to be infidelity.

title: 'Had no choice': How a job agent duped Hyd man into joining Russian army; family fears for life
description: A Hyderabad man, Mohammed Ahmed, allegedly defrauded by a job agent and sent to Russia, has reportedly signed a one-year contract with the Russian army.  Trapped near the Ukrainian border, Ahmed expressed fear and a lack of choice, pleading for rescue. His family has appealed to the Indian government for his safe return.
